page.title: 05High Hearth Stone - Kennoway
page.content:
The{High Hearth Stone}is situated within Balgriebank farm, but is not a part of the farm itself.
It was given to a family by the name of{Geddies}by{Edward 4th}because they uncovered a plot to assassinate him.
The High Hearth Stone was the highest inhabited point in the Kingdom of Fife some 205m above sea level. It was last inhabited in the early 1950's.
The owners now live in the Kilmarnock area of Ayrshire and the land is used for cattle and sheep grazing.
The views to the east, south and west are amongst the most beautiful in Fife.
